Waizenhofen is a small village with around 100 inhabitants, located in, Middle Franconia (
German is the only language spoken here, however there are some people living there who have a good knowledge of other foreign languages like English, French, Spanish or Italian.
Most people arrive in the area by road.
) is a small airfield serving the community of
and Waizenhofen and is about 45 km south of

. Currently the airfield is used for General Aviation purposes, primarily by private pilots in ultralight aircraft and helicopters. The airport has a maintenance facility for helicopters and microlights. Charter flights can be arranged from this airport. GPS Code: EDPW, Position latitude 49.0642;longitude 11.2092

Nuremberg Airport
is around 60 km to the north and is the nearest international airport to Waizenhofen.
The new ICE line runs from
and provides a rail service to the stations of

and Nuremberg. A bus service is provided to the region
.
The former railway line Greding-Thalmässing-Rothwas closed in 1974 and replaced by a bus service. The former rail bed was converted into a cycle path. See the
Starting from Thalmässing, buses are available. Apart from that, a walk for 20 min is enought to arrive there.

A9 motorway; exit 56 - Berlin-Munich-South Hilpoltstein junction. Junction  57 Greding. 

Turn west off the E45 at Großhöbing.
The village is easily managable on foot, since it takes only about 5 min from one end to the other.
To visit is the airstrip close to Waizenhofen, the old church, different houses, farms and fields. Also the "Espan" is worth a visit.

value: is offered at the airstrip about 5 min by car away from the village.
Thalmässing Waizenhofen has a skydiving club Skydive Colibri based at Thalmässing-Waizenhofen Airport

There is no store in Waizenhofen, however it is possible to buy products like milk, eggs or honey at different family-owned farms.

value: content=A hostel with 5 bedrooms is available in the centre of the village.
